復.definition: to go and return; to return; to resume; to return to a normal or original state; to repeat; again; to recover; to restore; to turn over; to reply; to answer; to reply to a letter; to retaliate; to carry out

復位.definition: to restore sb or sth to its original position; to regain the throne; to reset (a dislocated joint, an electronic device etc); reset

復元.definition: variant of 復原|复原[fu4 yuan2]

復出.definition: to come back out of retirement; to get involved again after having withdrawn

復刻.definition: to reprint (a work that has been out of print); to reissue (a vinyl album as a CD, etc); to replicate; to recreate; (computing) fork (loanword)

復原.definition: to restore (sth) to (its) former condition; to recover from illness; recovery

復古.definition: to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration); to turn back the clock; neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文; retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)

復古會.definition: anti-Qing revolutionary party set up in 1904 under Cai Yuanpei 蔡元培[Cai4 Yuan2pei2]; aka 光復會|光复会[Guang1fu4hui4]

復合.definition: (of people who were estranged) to be reconciled; (of a couple) to get back together

復吸.definition: to resume smoking (after giving up); to relapse into smoking or drug abuse

復命.definition: to report on completion of a mission; debriefing

復大.definition: Fudan University, Shanghai, abbr. for 復旦大學|复旦大学[Fu4 dan4 Da4 xue2]

復姓.definition: to revert to one's original surname

復學.definition: to return to school (after an interruption); to resume one's studies

復審.definition: to re-examine; to recheck; (law) to conduct a judicial review; to retry (a case)

復崗.definition: (of an employee) to return to one's job (e.g. after being temporarily stood down)

復工.definition: to return to work (after a stoppage)

復市.definition: (of a shop, market) to resume trading

復旦.definition: Fudan University, Shanghai, abbr. for 復旦大學|复旦大学[Fu4 dan4 Da4 xue2]

復核.definition: to reconsider; to reexamine; to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)

復權.definition: (finance) to adjust the price, volume etc of a security (typically to account for a stock split or after new shares are issued)

復活.definition: to revive; (lit. and fig.) to come back to life; (religion) resurrection

復生.definition: to be reborn; to recover; to come back to life; to regenerate

復甦.definition: to recover (health, economic); to resuscitate; anabiosis

復發.definition: to recur (of a disease); to reappear; to relapse (into a former bad state)

復盤.definition: (after completing a game of chess) to replay the game, analyzing the players' moves; (stock market) to resume trading

復社.definition: Fushe, late Ming political and cultural movement led by Zhang Pu 張溥|张溥[Zhang1 Pu3] and others, advocating the revival of ancient studies

復興區.definition: Fuxing district of Handan city 邯鄲市|邯郸市[Han2 dan1 shi4], Hebei

復舊.definition: to restore old way; to return to the past

復蘇.definition: variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]; to recover (health, economic); to resuscitate; anabiosis

復診.definition: another visit to doctor; further diagnosis

復讀.definition: to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school

復讀生.definition: student who repeats (a course, grade etc) at school

復轉.definition: to demobilize; to transfer to other tasks (of troops)

復辟.definition: to recover one's power or authority; restoration (of a past regime)

復陽.definition: to test positive again (for COVID-19) after previously testing positive and then later, negative; to have a rebound positive test result

復駛.definition: (of a public transportation route) to resume operating
